jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Qwilr we have revolutionised proposal capability. How? By building a highly advanced software platform, utilising some seriously innovative engineering brains belonging to a group of seriously awesome engineers.

Qwilr Engineering has transitioned over a decade of phenomenal pioneering. We’ve built monoliths, dabbled with micro-services, and everything we build is based on cloud-native distributed architecture.

If you want to make an outsized impact, contribute to the existing calibre of highly skilled software engineers and work in a great culture that values your balanced perspective, we look forward to hearing from you.

Read the full job description here: https://team.qwilr.com/Join-Qwilr-as-a-Senior-Software-Engineer-Sept-25-wmsaj1UjR6mW

About you

  • You're talented, humble and empathetic.

  • You love teamwork. You enjoy collaborating with others, in and outside of your engineering cohort - working as one, to achieve a shared dream.

  • You get stuff done - autonomously, and you reliably deliver your cleanly designed and implemented part of the puzzle that works beautifully with the rest of the puzzle - always.

  • You take your engineering team mates on the journey with you. Sharing what you know and learn as you go.

  • You're pragmatic in your approach to engineering problems, knowing there are always trade-offs and different times for different approaches. You know what good looks like and how to achieve it, while getting to market nice and early.

  • You care deeply about building and operating reliable, scalable, maintainable systems.

  • You care deeply about the overall customer experience.

  • You're always learning, keen to hone your craft and actively participate in team improvement.

  • Your capabilities include elevating the team around you - their quality and velocity is improved by your influence.

  • You want to work on, and have a say in, a product that can meaningfully impact people's businesses, across the world.

About the Team:

The team you’ll be working with are passionate about Qwilr as a product, and as an organisation. We strive to bring our A-game with us. Always. In engineering specifically, the broader team consists of an array of full-stack developers, as well as frontend, site reliability, and backend-integrations gurus.

What you’ll do:

  • Collaboratively design and deliver software and systems for Qwilr.

  • Shape, plan, build and operate Qwilr’s product features.

  • Design and implement solutions with an exceptional degree of technical understanding, and a glorious degree of excellence, balanced with an equally glorious desire to get stuff done.

  • Demonstrate capability when it comes to solving complex technical challenges cleanly, and with a passion for supportable software.

  • Iterate on team development practices and technical excellence/understanding - constantly improving yourself and contributing to the elevation of your Qwilr engineering team.

  • Seek a collaborative, clear, shared understanding of project requirements and priorities.

  • Find a balance between quality and speed that delivers consistently awesome results, aligned with Qwilr’s overall strategic goals.

  • Work autonomously, with a strong bias for collaboration, helping to uplift your team, demonstrating an openness to growth.

Our Stack:

  • React, Nodejs, Javascript, Typescript

  • MongoDB, Druid

  • Kafka, AWS, Eventing, Terraform, Kubernetes

Research supports our observation that some of us - particularly underrepresented groups - feel we need to tick every box in a job ad before applying. If you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point above, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit. You can find more about diversity and inclusion at Qwilr here.

About us:

Qwilr is remote-friendly and supports flexible working arrangements. We have Engineers in Adelaide, Melbourne, and various parts of NSW.

  • We have a modern, characterful office in Redfern, Sydney, that most of the Sydney-siders attend a few days each week, it's up to you though!

  • We value focussed work and endeavour to have meeting-free days to get things done, and "Bonsai Days" each quarter to scratch a technical or product itch

  • We offer ZEPO's (equity) for all our employees

  • Budget for your home and/or office setup

  • $1000 - 2500 for further education, conferences and books

  • Company-wide global retreats each year (check out our 2025 Retreat below!)

  • Charity donations matching and volunteering days off

And at Qwilr, you'll get to do challenging, rewarding work in a supportive environment with smart and dedicated colleagues

Learn more about our team and how we work here: https://team.qwilr.com/Join-Qwilr-as-a-Senior-Software-Engineer-Sept-25-wmsaj1UjR6mW

jobs.title: Payments Growth Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Qwilr, we've packaged up the perfect way to create documents: amazing, design-perfect pages, which anyone can create. They come with payment, e-sign, easy integration into your CRM, and all the other functionality you wish your old PDF documents had. We have made a beautiful product that solves customers' needs, and that in turn has made us a strong business, with a multi-million dollar ARR, consistent growth and incredibly low churn. It's now time for us to scale this growth and we want you to come and be part of it.

To read the full job description and APPLY, head to: https://team.qwilr.com/slDWtPIdSOWU

About the Role

We’re hiring a Payments Growth Manager to drive adoption and usage of QwilrPay across our customer base. This role is about building systems, experimenting to find what works, and driving revenue by getting as many customers as possible using QwilrPay and helping them have a great time so they continue to use it.

You’ll work closely with Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, and Product to identify opportunities, run enablement campaigns, and help customers see the value of accepting payments through Qwilr.

This is a highly visible role with a clear revenue impact. You’ll be at the center of one of Qwilr’s biggest growth initiatives.

Note: this is a fully remote role for folks based on the West Coast of the United States of America. If you are not located in the PST or MT timezone, your application will be automatically rejected.

Your Impact

1. Enable New Customers to Adopt QwilrPay

  • Build a repeatable system to identify new customers who are a strong fit for QwilrPay and proactively guide them to get set up via face to face meetings and async support

  • Partner with Sales and Customer Success to help managed accounts adopt QwilrPay early in their lifecycle.

  • Reach out to customers entering the QwilrPay onboarding flow to ensure they complete setup and succeed in taking their first payment.

2. Maximize Usage Within the Existing Customer Base

  • Identify and execute growth experiments across our current customer base, focusing on those who are most likely to benefit from QwilrPay adoption

  • Design and run campaigns (e.g., success calls, in-app messages, email nudges, marketing programs) to increase activation and transaction volume.

  • Partner with Marketing and Product to improve in-app messaging and the QwilrPay experience based on your insights.

3. Experiment, Measure, and Scale

  • Treat QwilrPay adoption as a growth lab — run experiments, measure what works, and scale winning motions.

  • Track leading indicators (adoptions, activations, first payments) and lagging indicators (transaction volume, QwilrPay revenue contribution).

  • Bring structured, data-informed thinking to a fast-moving initiative with high impact.

Why This Role Matters

QwilrPay is one of our biggest untapped revenue opportunities. Every transaction that runs through QwilrPay is a win-win for our customers and our business. With thousands of eligible accounts not yet using QwilrPay, and many good fit customers joining Qwilr everyday, the potential for impact is enormous.

You’ll join a small, focused team dedicated to making QwilrPay a core part of how customers do business on Qwilr.

About You

  • Scrappy and experimental — you’re energized by testing ideas, learning quickly, and finding what works.

  • Comfortable speaking with customers — whether to troubleshoot onboarding or gather insights on what’s blocking adoption.

  • Results oriented - you like to be given a measurable goal and are excited at the opportunity to go attain it

  • Operationally minded — you think in systems and can design scalable processes.

  • Collaborative — you work well across functions like Sales, CS, Marketing, and Product.

Your Experience

  • Experience in Customer Success, Sales, or Growth at a SaaS company.

  • Experience in operational or growth-focused work.

  • Proven ability to influence customer behavior through direct outreach, automation, or enablement.

  • Bonus: experience with Stripe, SaaS billing, or payment products.

    Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other folks in minority groups tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point above, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.

To read the full job description and APPLY, head to: https://team.qwilr.com/slDWtPIdSOWU

We’re expecting a lot of interest in this role, so to help us spot the folks who are genuinely excited about Qwilr, we’re asking all applicants to include a short Loom video (max 3 mins) with their application. The instructions for the contents of the video will be in the application form. Applications without a video won’t be considered. This helps us keep the process intentional, worthwhile and human.

jobs.title: Director of Customer Success
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Qwilr, we've packaged up the perfect way to create documents: amazing, design-perfect pages, which anyone can create. They come with payment, e-sign, easy integration into your CRM, and all the other functionality you wish your old PDF documents had. We have made a beautiful product that solves customers' needs, and that in turn has made us a strong business, with a multi-million dollar ARR, consistent growth and incredibly low churn. It's now time for us to scale this growth and we want you to come and be part of it.

To read the full job description and APPLY, head to: https://team.qwilr.com/L3B2BhWcSuOj

About the Role

Qwilr is seeking a commercially minded Customer Success leader to help us create an exceptional experience for our customers, while also driving meaningful revenue outcomes for our business.

As Director of Customer Success you'll own our global Success & Support strategy, lead and scale a high performing team and play a critical role in how our customers experience Qwilr.

Our ideal candidate will also be excited to meaningfully improve both our GRR and our NRR.

Qwilr's customers are primarily larger SMB and early Mid-Market (with some larger Enterprise accounts).

This role will be part of the GTM leadership team of the company and will report directly to our CEO.

If you’re excited to design strategy, build teams, stay close to customers, and make a meaningful impact to Qwilr's revenue, then we are eager to chat with you!

Note: this is a fully remote role for folks based on the West Coast of the United States of America. If you are not located in the PST timezone, your application will be automatically rejected.

Your Impact

Qwilr has a long history of excellent customer support for our customers that we are very proud of.
​We are looking for someone to continue that tradition - while also making a meaningful commercial impact on our business.

  • You will help us improve our retention - especially for our larger accounts. We care about GRR & NRR improving over time.

  • You will help us build a much more robust expansion & cross selling motion.

  • You are excited to build and own the strategy for this team - but you are also still excited to do the actual work and love interacting with customers. We do not want someone who is totally off the tools and expects to never speak to customers.

  • You are excited to help us improve our use of AI in Support and Success

  • You will work with our Revenue Team to contribute to company revenue goals

    • This will include working closely with the RevOps team and the Head of Sales

  • You will help our product team shape important product releases

  • You will build and grow an excellent team

About You

  • You have a history of leading high performing customer success teams at SaaS companies that not only deliver exceptional experiences for your customers - but also drive meaningful revenue for the company.

  • You can walk the walk and actually do the core of the job excellently (ie you are not just a manager)

  • You are very comfortable with data and understand the fundamental metrics that drive a SaaS business and deeply understand where your team's performance slots into the bigger picture.

  • You can hire A+ people to your team (and ideally already have a few people in mind who might be a great fit)

  • You get energy from coaching and growing your team

  • You have existing playbooks for thinking about Onboarding, Expansion, Renewals, Churn deflection etc - but aren't wedded to them and can be adaptable if the situation requires it.

  • You are comfortable working remote and getting the most out of a mostly remote team.

  • ✨ Bonus Points ✨ if you have ever worked with Payments before (a la QwilrPay)

Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other folks in minority groups tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point above, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.

To read more about Qwilr, perks and the team, and to APPLY head to: https://team.qwilr.com/L3B2BhWcSuOj

We’re expecting a lot of interest in this role, so to help us spot the folks who are genuinely excited about Qwilr, we’re asking all applicants to include a short Loom video (2-4 mins) with their application. The instructions for the contents of the video will be in the application form. Applications without a video won’t be considered. This helps us keep the process intentional, worthwhile and human.
